# Canadian Hydrographic Service – Arctic Multibeam Survey using Uncrewed Surface Vessel (USV)

## Introduction

The Canadian Hydrographic Service (CHS) of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is soliciting proposals for an Arctic multibeam survey using an uncrewed surface vessel (USV) to meet its requirement for hydrographic data collection in the eastern Canadian Arctic.

## Background and Scope

The purpose of this project is to collect high-resolution, full bottom coverage bathymetry, topographic data, and tidal/current data to produce new navigational products and datasets. The proposed survey will take place between mid-August and the end of October, with the exact dates to be provided upon contract award.

## Requirements

The Contractor will be responsible for providing a USV equipped with a mid-water multibeam sonar system capable of mapping up to 700m water depth, as well as a Launch and Recovery System (LARS). The Contractor will also be responsible for integrating and calibrating the multibeam sonar system and sound velocity profiling system installed on the USV.

## Work Scope

The Contractor will be required to attend to the CHS Ship's southern mobilization port to deliver and mobilize all USV equipment and LARS. The Contractor will also be responsible for the demobilization of all USV equipment upon completion of the survey.

## Project Timeline

The project timeline is as follows:

* August 10 – October 10, 2023: Survey period
* August 1, 2023: Expected contract start date
* December 31, 2023: Expected contract end date

## Evaluation Criteria

The proposals will be evaluated based on the Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price.
